events.title: Australia heatwave live updates: Victorian bushfires raze scores of properties as new warnings issued; temperatures climb in Sydney
events.description: Total fire ban in place for whole of Victoria as bushfires burn, while Sydney prepares for the brunt of the heatwave ‘If you have been told to leave, go’: Victorian premier declares state of disaster in multiple areas as bushfires burn out of control CFA volunteer Simon fought the fire that destroyed his own home: ‘I knew eventually it would get to us’ Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast NSW working to send more firefighting teams to Victoria New South Wales is moving to send additional firefighting teams to Victoria after a request for assistance, the premier says. There’s over 90 firefighters from NSW in Victoria. At the moment their agencies have asked for more strike teams. My understanding is the RFS is filling those gaps as quickly as possible and sending them across the Murray. It will be an incredibly challenging day for the health system, as well as the RFS and Fire and Rescue. And we’re calling on the community to do their bit, and that means look after one enough, particularly the vulnerable, particularly the old and the young. Make sure that you look after your pets as well. Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian regime's 'iron fist': Internet blackout as protests swell to hundreds of thousands
events.description: Protests in Iran began days before the new year and have spread nationwide to more than 170 locations in 25 provinces. With increasing discontent over the faltering economy and protesters now chanting anti-regime statements, Gavin Lee welcomes Ali VAEZ, Director of Iran Project & Senior Advisor at the International Crisis Group. He is emphasising the seriousness of the political crisis in Iran and the current unrest, while noting the factors that prevent a full-fledged revolution.

events.title: Sudan: After 1,000 days of war, millions of civilians still bearing brunt
events.description: Aid agencies marked 1,000 days of war in Sudan on Friday with a grim reminder that the conflict has created the world’s biggest hunger crisis and largest displacement emergency. Every day, civilians have been “paying the price for a war they did not choose”, said UN aid coordination office, OCHA.

events.title: West Bank: UN report warns of ‘systematic asphyxiation’ of Palestinian rights
events.description: A sweeping UN human rights report released on Wednesday concludes that in the occupied West Bank, Israel is violating international law prohibiting racial segregation and apartheid, warning that the discriminatory practices have accelerated dramatically since late 2022 amid growing violence, repression and impunity.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran: UN human rights chief ‘deeply disturbed’ by protest-related violence
events.description: The UN human rights chief has called for an independent and transparent investigation into reports of deaths and widespread arrests during ongoing nationwide protests in Iran, amid mounting concerns over the use of force by security forces.

events.title: More than 100 buildings destroyed and 300,000 hectares burned as Victoria’s bushfires rage
events.description: Fires may continue for ‘weeks’, authorities warn, as three missing people found safe Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast At least 119 structures are believed to be lost in bushfires across Victoria and more than 300,000 hectares of bushland has been burned as the state continues to battle blazes that may rage for “weeks”. Emergency management commissioner, Tim Wiebusch, told the media on Saturday that about 50 homes had been lost in the Ravenswood and Harcourt fire, which was believed to be a “conservative number”. The Bendigo railway line had also been damaged by fire and was closed. Continue reading...

events.title: Global economy shows signs of steady but subdued growth
events.description: The global economy has shown resilience amid turbulence during the past year, including shifting trade policies – yet growth remains subdued and far below pre-pandemic levels, the UN said in a landmark report published on Thursday.

events.title: Noem praises DHS officers on Law Enforcement Appreciation Day as attacks on federal agents spike nationwide
events.description: Federal immigration agents face 8,000% spike in death threats as Homeland Security chief Kristi Noem praises officers on Law Enforcement Appreciation Day.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation’s impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that “ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians” were hit with “numerous perfect strikes”. Continue reading...

events.title: Death penalty threat as Iran's supreme leader says protesters 'ruining' country to please Trump
events.description: Iran's supreme leader has warned of a crackdown on protesters, with a prosecutor in Tehran saying some could face the death penalty.

events.title: Almost 50 writers boycott Adelaide festival after it dumps pro-Palestine academic Randa Abdel-Fattah
events.description: Helen Garner and Miles Franklin winner Michelle de Kretser among 47 people who have pulled out of annual writers’ festival to protest Abdel-Fattah’s axing Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Adelaide festival has pulled down part of its website as dozens of speakers said they were boycotting writers’ week, after Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah was dumped from the lineup with the board citing “cultural sensitivity” concerns in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. The page promoting the schedule of authors, journalists, academics and commentators was “unpublished” on Friday following widespread condemnation of the board’s decision to remove Abdel-Fattah. Continue reading...

events.title: World News in Brief: Storms in Syria, school attacks in Nigeria, strikes continue in southern Lebanon
events.description: Thousands of displaced people in northern Syria are struggling to cope with freezing conditions after a severe snowstorm struck dozens of displacement sites, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Georgia lawmaker accused of ripping off taxpayers with pandemic unemployment fraud announces retirement
events.description: Georgia Rep. Karen Bennett was accused of unemployment fraud and charged with making false statements to collect $13,940 in COVID benefits while working.

events.title: One dead, dozens trapped after giant landfill collapses in Philippines
events.description: Rescuers have pulled 12 injured sanitation workers from debris at the private landfill in Cebu City.

events.title: Deadly trash avalanche in Filipino landfill leaves dozens missing
events.description: A collapse of trash at a landfill in Cebu city, Philippines killed one worker, injured at least 12 and left 27 missing.

events.title: Minnesota schools shut down, teachers union demands ICE leave city
events.description: Minnesota schools cancel classes Friday as protests continue over fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by ICE agent Wednesday in Minneapolis area.

events.title: Iranian supreme leader says protesters 'ruining their own streets' to please Trump
events.description: Iran reportedly cuts nationwide internet as protests intensified and President Donald Trump threatens intervention if peaceful demonstrators face violence.

events.title: Iranian military leader threatens preemptive attack after Trump comments
events.description: Iran army chief threatens preemptive military action after President Donald Trump warned the U.S. is "locked and loaded" if the regime kills protesters.

events.title: Philippines: Dozens missing after deadly landfill collapse
events.description: Rescue workers were searching for at least 34 sanitation workers who were trapped after a mound of garbage buried them at a dump in the central Philippines. At least one person has been confirmed dead.

events.title: World News in Brief: Repression in Uganda, fighting in Syria’s Aleppo continues, Gaza and West Bank updates
events.description: The UN has raised serious concerns ahead of Uganda’s elections scheduled for 15 January, warning they will take place in an environment marked by widespread repression, intimidation and shrinking civic space.

events.title: South Sudan: Increase in abductions and sexual violence ‘unacceptable’
events.description: Despite reductions in the overall number of conflict-related incidents in South Sudan, a rise in abductions and sexual violence is concerning, the UN peacekeeping mission in the country, UNMISS, said on Friday.

events.title: Human Rights Council elects Indonesian candidate President for 2026
events.description: The UN Human Rights Council – the world’s principal defender of vulnerable people worldwide – has elected an Indonesian diplomat to be President for 2026 in a first for the country.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia’s ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women’s rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country’s supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country’s parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: US troops in Germany are legacy of World War II, Cold War
events.description: Donald Trump's desire to acquire Greenland has raised questions about the US's commitment to NATO. The US maintains a major military presence in Germany — a vital part of its post-World War II national defense strategy.

events.title: Syria: Fighting between Kurds and Damascus raise fears of wider war
events.description: Deadly fighting between Kurdish forces and Syria's national army in Aleppo has led to new widespread displacement. As thousands flee amid shelling, can international mediators stop a full-scale war?

events.title: Myanmar vote a ‘facade’ to entrench military rule, independent rights expert says
events.description: An independent human rights expert has urged the international community to reject the electoral process organised by Myanmar’s military government, after the first round of voting revealed widespread coercion, exclusion and violence.

events.title: World News in Brief: Fighting intensifies in Syria’s Aleppo and South Sudan’s Jonglei state, acute hunger in Niger
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres continues to be gravely alarmed by escalating hostilities in Aleppo, Syria, and mounting reports of civilian casualties, his Spokesperson said on Thursday.

events.title: Trump’s attack leaves China worried about its interests in Venezuela | Amy Hawkins
events.description: Maduro had just affirmed ‘strong bonds of brotherhood’ with Beijing when US made its shocking intervention Venezuela crisis – latest updates Hours before his life and the fate of his country was changed dramatically, Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, was exchanging smiles and handshakes with a Chinese delegation in the presidential palace in Caracas. On Friday evening, shortly before he was seized by US forces , Maduro wrote on Telegram of his meeting with China’s special envoy for Latin American affairs, Qiu Xiaoqi: “A fraternal meeting that reaffirms the strong bonds of brotherhood and friendship between China and Venezuela. Through thick and thin!” Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Toughest conditions imaginable’: Victorians urged to shelter inside from heatwave as tropical cyclone heads for Queensland
events.description: Heatwave warnings in place for nearly all states and territories as Sydney braces for 43C forecast on Saturday Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A heatwave engulfing much of Australia pushed Melbourne’s mercury past 42C, as authorities urged Victorians to stay indoors on Friday. The extreme heat is forecast to descend on Sydney on Saturday. Anthony Albanese met officials in Canberra for a briefing on the extreme conditions and said these were “difficult times” for the country. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia uses its new Oreshnik missile in a big attack on Ukraine and a warning to West
events.description: For only the second time, Russia used a new ballistic missile that it says flies at 10 times the speed of sound and is unstoppable by air defenses.

events.title: Uganda's debt crisis deepens ahead of elections
events.description: With debt at record highs and new loans approved, Uganda faces growing pressure. Economists warn the strategy may backfire on future growth.

events.title: California driver allegedly kills 2 more people while out on bail for previous fatal crash
events.description: A Southern California driver is accused of a fatal hit-and-run and another crash that allegedly killed a bicyclist and two others. Video evidence allegedly linked the suspect to the crashes.

events.title: Iran protests grow deadlier as regime internet blackout fails to stop uprising
events.description: Iran's anti-government protests enter day 13 with reported death toll of 51, including 9 children, as demonstrations spread nationwide against the regime.

events.title: Swiss authorities detain owner of bar where New Year’s fire killed 40
events.description: Switzerland holds national day of mourning to remember victims of deadly fire in ski resort town of Crans-Montana.

events.title: What can Trump offer Big Oil to bring US capital back to Venezuela?
events.description: US President Donald Trump has openly set his sights on Venezuela’s vast oil reserves, claiming Friday that US oil giants were going to invest upward of $100 billion in the country’s gutted industry. But analysts warn that relaunching Venezuela’s oil production could cost dearly in both time and money – even if the enduring Chavista administration continues to bend under US pressure.

events.title: After decades of negotiations, EU-Mercosur deal hinges on France and Italy
events.description: Alberto Rizzi, Policy Fellow at the European Council on Foreign Relations, sheds light on the shifting European political calculus surrounding the long-awaited EU-Mercosur trade agreement. Italy’s recent pivot in favor of the deal reveals a strategic weighing of national economic benefits over protecting Italian farmers. Rizzi offers a nuanced view, cautioning against viewing this as a monolithic threat or panacea. At its heart, this is a case study in how modern democracies grapple with global interdependence and rural disenfranchisement.

events.title: Surveillance footage shows immigration activist blocking road before fatal ICE shooting
events.description: Surveillance footage shows moments before immigration activist was allegedly shot by ICE agents during enforcement operation in Minneapolis area.

events.title: Russia fires new ballistic missile at Ukraine, killing at least four
events.description: Ukrainian authorities reported multiple deaths and infrastructure damage after Russia said it deployed a new missile system in an overnight strike.

events.title: Iran: Internet cut off as protests spread nationwide
events.description: The demonstrations, which were sparked by anger over the rising cost of living, have been met with a crackdown by Iran's Islamic regime. Donald Trump has said the US will hit Iran "very hard" if protesters are killed.

events.title: The pope in a major foreign policy address blasts how countries are using force to assert dominion
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has denounced how nations are increasingly using force to assert their dominion worldwide

events.title: Switzerland honors victims of deadly Alpine bar fire in national day of mourning
events.description: Switzerland will hold a memorial service to honor the 40 people who were killed in an Alpine bar fire earlier this month during a New Year’s celebration

events.title: UN’s ‘responsibility to deliver’ will not waver, after US announces withdrawal from dozens of international organizations
events.description: Secretary-General António Guterres has expressed regret over the decision by the United States to withdraw from a number of UN entities, while underscoring that the system will continue to deliver on all its mandates.

events.title: Thirteen more lives lost in Sudan as 1,000th day of war looms
events.description: Thirteen more lives – including children – were reportedly lost on Tuesday in another drone attack on Sudan’s North Kordofan region.

events.title: Minnesota woman killed in US Virgin Islands shark attack
events.description: Minnesota woman reportedly dies after shark attack at U.S. Virgin Islands beach, according to authorities investigating the incident on St. Croix.

events.title: Venezuela says 100 were killed in US operation to capture Maduro: report
events.description: Venezuelan official claims 100 killed in U.S. operation to capture President Nicolás Maduro, while Cuba reports 32 of its forces died in weekend mission.

events.title: Russian winter strike leaves nearly 800K homes without power and heat in Ukraine’s Dnipro region
events.description: Russia's overnight attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure leaves nearly 800,000 homes without power amid freezing winter temperatures across the country.

events.title: Trump says US will take Greenland the 'easy way or hard way'
events.description: The US president has said risking war against Denmark is necessary to prevent Russia or China taking the world's biggest island.

events.title: Hospital attack highlights 'brutality' of Iran clampdown
events.description: Iranian forces "behaved with savage brutality" when they stormed a hospital in Ilam, a nurse told DW. Mass protests continue to grow.

events.title: Iran goes dark: Regime cuts internet amid protests, unrest
events.description: The internet is down across most of Iran as the protests escalate toward a potential turning point.

events.title: Home alone in a hostile world: Is 2026 the year Europe will fend for itself?
events.description: As 2026 gets off to a rocky start, Europe finds itself squeezed between brute force and awkward dependence. After the US seizure of Venezuela's leader, President Donald Trump has openly floated using military force to acquire Greenland, part of NATO member Denmark. European leaders insist it will not happen. The harder question is whether they could stop it if Washington decided otherwise.

events.title: George Clooney's French move ruffles feathers with Trump
events.description: When the Clooney family were granted French citizenship, the news made headlines around the world. The US president weighed in on their choice, sparking a war of words; we learn more about the transatlantic row pitting Hollywood against la vie en France. Also, a new film about the British featherweight who became a giant of boxing brings "Prince" Naseem Hamed's life and career to the big screen. Plus we take a closer look at the frozen landscape that helped Claude Monet refine his painting technique during a very cold snap.

events.title: Somalia denies US allegation that it destroyed food aid warehouse
events.description: Somalia’s government is denying an allegation by the U.S. government that authorities in Mogadishu destroyed an American-funded warehouse belonging to the World Food Program

events.title: Iran regime said to unleash Hezbollah and Iraqi militias as uprising spreads
events.description: Iran’s regime is accused of importing foreign militias to crush protests, as experts warn the move marks a dangerous escalation to suppress domestic unrest.

events.title: New video of Minneapolis ICE shooting surfaces
events.description: New video has emerged of the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by an ICE agent in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

events.title: EU states back controversial Mercosur deal with Latin American countries
events.description: Agreement after 25 years of negotiations prompts farmers to block roads in Paris, Brussels and Warsaw European Union member states have backed the biggest ever free trade agreement with a group of Latin American countries, ending 25 years of negotiations but stoking further tensions with farmers and environmentalists around the bloc. The contentious Mercosur deal with Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay prompted immediate protests in Poland, France, Greece and Belgium, with farmers blocking key roads in Paris, Brussels and Warsaw. Continue reading...

events.title: Mound of garbage collapses at Philippine landfill, burying 38 people and killing 1
events.description: Officials say an avalanche of garbage and debris buried or trapped workers at a landfill in the Philippines, killing one person, injuring a dozen and leaving 38 others missing

events.title: Ukraine: Massive overnight attack leaves millions in the dark
events.description: UN agencies are supporting efforts on Friday to keep energy services up and running in Ukraine, and families warm amid freezing winter temperatures, following a large-scale overnight attack.

events.title: Preliminary autopsy reveals possible cause of death for missing 4-year-old Alabama boy Johnathan Boley
events.description: Preliminary autopsy findings reveal possible cause of death for 4-year-old Johnathan Boley who disappeared on New Year's Eve in rural Alabama community.

events.title: Cellphone video released in deadly Minneapolis ICE agent shooting
events.description: Cellphone footage shows the fatal shooting of a Minneapolis woman by an ICE agent during an alleged vehicle ramming incident amid Trump immigration enforcement tensions.

events.title: Why is the US quitting international organisations?
events.description: Donald Trump signs orders to withdraw from dozens of agencies.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Iran: Protests continue amid internet shutdown
events.description: Mass protests over the dire economic situation in Iran continue to grow across the country. Iranian authorities have imposed an internet blackout in a bid to quell the unrest. DW has more.

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.description: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure at previous World Cups.

events.title: Cross-border operation against 'Black Axe' crime gang sees 34 arrests in Spain
events.description: Spanish police have arrested dozens of members of an international criminal gang on suspicion of fraud, ⁠money laundering and document forgery, Europol said on Friday.

events.title: What the US withdrawal from UN bodies could mean for climate, trade and development
events.description: The United States’ intention to withdraw from a host of UN bodies announced this week targets programmes and initiatives focusing on a wide range of crucial areas, including the climate crisis, trade, gender and development.

events.title: Romance and parenthood feel remote in Ukraine: 'I haven't had a date since before the war'
events.description: Tumbling marriage and birth rates are shaping the future of a country whose population was already falling.

events.title: What does the US raid in Venezuela mean for China’s designs on Taiwan?
events.description: Perception that Chinese-made weapons could not stop a ‘decapitation strike’ may give Beijing pause for thought The sight of a hostile regional superpower launching an overnight raid to depose the leader of a smaller neighbouring country could easily have sent pulses in Taiwan racing. The US on Saturday revealed the details of a surprise raid to capture Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro , who was whisked away to the US, where he was frogmarched into a court in New York on Monday . Continue reading...

events.title: China loses, but also gains a lot from Trump's Venezuela move, analyst says
events.description: China has strongly condemned the US attack on Venezuela and capture of President Nicolas Maduro. Beijing had built a strategic partnership with the South American country, and been trying to expand its diplomatic and economic clout in the region. Steve Tsang, Director of the SOAS China Institute, tells FRANCE 24's Yuka Royer that China has a lot to lose but also to gain from the ongoing situation.

events.title: Crime reporter killed in Mexico's Veracruz state
events.description: A reporter covering crime in Mexico’s Gulf coast state of Veracruz has been killed in Poza Rica

events.title: Iraq ‘unrecognisable and remarkable’ after years of conflict: UN coordinator
events.description: Some two decades after a shaky political transition, Iraq today is a country “at peace, with increased security and a clear determination to win the battle of development,” says the UN resident coordinator for Iraq on Wednesday.

events.title: Portland agitators clash with police after 2 shot by federal immigration agent
events.description: Portland demonstrations erupt near ICE building after Border Patrol shooting, leading to police clashes and more arrests now totally at least 79 people.

events.title: Renee Nicole Good part of 'ICE Watch' group, DHS sources say
events.description: Minneapolis immigration activist and 'ICE Watch' member allegedly shot by federal agent after swerving car toward officer during enforcement operation.

events.title: Iran regime cuts nationwide internet access as protests claim 44 lives across major cities
events.description: Iranian protests sparked by a currency collapse evolved into a broader uprising demanding regime overthrow, with demonstrators torching government buildings across provinces.

events.title: Video emerges of Minneapolis shooting filmed by ICE agent who opened fire
events.description: The clip shows the moments before gunfire rang out on a Minneapolis street.

events.title: Night of Swiss ski bar fire 'apocalyptic', woman tells Crans-Montana memorial
events.description: A woman named Marie who was in a bar opposite Le Constellation helped the injured as they ran from the flames.

events.title: Second night of US protests over ICE shooting of woman in Minneapolis
events.description: Protests over the killing of Renee Good took place in Houston, Cincinnati, Washington DC and Philadelphia.

events.title: Trump threatens to take Greenland ‘the hard way’, citing Arctic strategy
events.description: Danish PM warns US armed action in Greenland could destabilise NATO and threaten Arctic security cooperation.

events.title: Trump claims he has cancelled second wave of attacks on Venezuela
events.description: US president does not elaborate on alleged plan for fresh strikes but says large naval presence in region will remain US politics live – latest updates Donald Trump has claimed that he cancelled a second wave of attacks on Venezuela because it was cooperating with the US on oil infrastructure and had released political prisoners. The US president said he had cancelled planned military action in recognition that the authorities in Caracas had released “large numbers” of prisoners and were “seeking peace”. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political detainees to ‘consolidate peace’
events.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado hails move to tackle ‘injustice’ as Spain’s foreign ministry confirms release of five Spanish nationals Five days after the US seized Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela has announced it is releasing an “important number” of detainees in what the congressional president characterised as a gesture to “consolidate peace”. Former opposition candidate Enrique Márquez was among those released from prison, according to an opposition statement. “It’s all over now,” Márquez said in a video taken by a local journalist who accompanied him and his wife, as well as another opposition member Biagio Pilieri, who was also released. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Not what you see on the map': French ambassador to Ukraine challenges Russia's victory narrative
events.description: Nearly four years into Russia's full-scale invasion, the war in Ukraine grinds on, and the search for a viable off-ramp looks increasingly narrow. Speaking to FRANCE 24’s Douglas Herbert, France's ambassador to Ukraine, Gaël Veyssière, delivers a pointed rebuttal to Moscow's battlefield narrative, warning that the Kremlin's perception and reality are increasingly at odds.

events.title: M23 rebel group holds a symbolic funeral for victims of drone strike in eastern Congo
events.description: The Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group has held a symbolic burial for 22 people killed in a drone strike in eastern Congo

events.title: Border Patrol agent hugs protester in heartwarming moment caught on video during Minnesota operation
events.description: A Border Patrol agent and a protester shared a hug that was caught on camera after they discovered shared service during immigration protests.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Ohio dentist murders, Kohberger sister's warning, 'Torso Killer' confession
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Russia fires new hypersonic missile in massive Ukraine attack, Kremlin says
events.description: Russia fired a hypersonic Oreshnik missile at Ukraine in retaliation for an alleged attack on one of Putin's residences that the U.S. and Ukraine have denied.

events.title: Iranian protesters rename Tehran street after Trump, plead 'don't let them kill us' amid crackdown
events.description: Iranian protesters appeal to President Donald Trump amid nationwide demonstrations against the regime, with reports of deadly crackdowns and arrests across cities.

events.title: Huge anti-government protests in Tehran and other Iranian cities, videos show
events.description: Rallies on major roads in the capital and in Iran's second city were peaceful and not dispersed by security forces.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk’s SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: Dr. Hamza al-Mustafa says Syria seeks peaceful solution, accuses SDF of failing to honour agreement
events.description: Dr. Hamza al‑Mustafa, Syria’s Information Minister in Damascus, articulates the Syrian government’s position on the ongoing confrontation with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). At its core, the exchange centres on competing visions for the future of Syria: one that emphasises state sovereignty and territorial unity under a single government, and one that involves elements within the SDF seeking de facto autonomy. Dr. al‑Mustafa frames the conflict not as a spontaneous escalation, but as a continuation of unresolved political agreements.

events.title: Chinese, Russian and Iranian warships arrive in South Africa for naval drills as tensions run high
events.description: Chinese, Russian and Iranian warships are in South African waters for a week of naval drills as geopolitical tensions run high over the United States’ intervention in Venezuela

events.title: Idaho murder victims’ families file wrongful death lawsuit against Washington State University
events.description: Civil lawsuit claims Idaho murders were "foreseeable and preventable" as families seek damages from Washington State University over Kohberger case.

events.title: Minneapolis mayor demands state be included in ICE-involved shooting probe, slams Pam Bondi's DOJ
events.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey slams Attorney General Pam Bondi and the Justice Department while speaking about the aftermath of the ICE-involved shooting.

events.title: Switzerland holds memorial service during day of national mourning
events.description: Switzerland held a national day of mourning on Friday for the 40 people who died in an Alpine bar fire during a New Year's Eve celebration.

events.title: US seizes fifth oil tanker linked to Venezuela, officials say
events.description: The tanker, the Olina, is on multiple countries' sanctions list and is "suspected of carrying embargoed oil", US officials say.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: Alleged scam kingpin Chen Zhi arrives in China after extradition from Cambodia
events.description: Chen founded multinational conglomerate Prince Group that US says is front for multibillion-dollar fraud operation Chinese television has shown footage of the US-indicted tycoon Chen Zhi being escorted by armed police after his extradition to China from Cambodia, where authorities on Thursday ordered the liquidation of a bank he founded linked to a massive “scam centre” network. Chen, who chairs a conglomerate the US says is a front for a multibillion-dollar online fraud operation, was shown in handcuffs and hooded as he was led off a plane at a Beijing airport by black-clad Swat officers, with the state broadcaster CCTV describing him as the “leader of a major transnational gambling and fraud crime syndicate”. Continue reading...

events.title: "This isn't a circus!" - Are Moroccan fans' expectations too big?
events.description: The Moroccan team has drawn comparisons to France's squad that won the World Cup in 1998. Neither side impressed much at this point of the tournament, but is this comparison fair?

events.title: Global anger over Grok undressing women online
events.description: There's global outrage over Elon Musk's chatbot Grok, a key feature on social media platform X, which has repeatedly generated sexually explicit deepfake images of women and teenagers. Yet how social media can be used for good; Annette Young talks to Nika Kovač from My Voice, My Choice about using Instagram, TikTok and other platforms to help win a historic European Parliament vote on expanding abortion access. Plus turning the tables on gender equality; the Kenyan music academy offering training courses for women wanting to become DJs.

events.title: Swiss bar owners detained as investigation into deadly New Year fire continues
events.description: Jacques Moretti, co-owner of a bar where 40 people died in a fire on New Year's Day, has been arrested a Swiss prosecutor has said.

events.title: Russia's use of hypersonic missile brings fresh threat to Europe and NATO
events.description: Russia's inclusion of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile (IRBM) in its latest missile and drone strikes on Ukraine has drawn attention well beyond the immediate battlefield - raising urgent questions about the wider security implications for Europe and NATO alike.

events.title: Colombia sees 'real threat' of US military action, president tells BBC
events.description: Gustavo Petro tells the BBC's Ione Wells that the United States is treating other nations as part of a US "empire", after Trump threatened Colombia with military action.

events.title: South Africa's strained ties with US face new test - war games with China, Iran and Russia
events.description: The naval exercises could inflame relations with Donald Trump - who is already at loggerheads with Pretoria.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,416
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,416 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Minnesotans mourn woman killed by ICE
events.description: People paid tribute to 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good, who was killed in her car by ICE agents in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Southern Yemen separatist group says it will dissolve after its head fled to the UAE
events.description: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council and its institutions will be dismantled after weeks of unrest in southern areas and a day after its leader fled to the United Arab Emirates.

events.title: Greenland minister rejects US overtures to buy the territory
events.description: As the United States increases its overtures and threats, Greenland's mining minister told DW that the territory needs to be treated as a partner, and said the people would decide the fate of their island's resources.

events.title: Czechia ruling coalition divided on support for Ukraine
events.description: Czechia's new coalition government is sending out conflicting messages on Ukraine — ranging from anti-Kyiv tirades to halfhearted support. What's going on?

events.title: EU countries greenlight Mercosur free trade deal
events.description: A majority of EU member states have voted in favor the long-awaited Mercosur trade agreement with South American countries. Farmers in a number of member states have protested the deal.

events.title: Algeria vs Nigeria: a clash of giants?
events.description: Both teams have won all of their games at AFCON and have demonstrated strong attacking talent on the field. Will this be the toughest of all quarter-finals this year?

events.title: Russia joins Chinese and Iranian warships in South Africa naval drills
events.description: In tonight's edition: Russian,Chinese, and Iranian warships arrive at South Africa's ports for a week of naval exercises. Also, just one month after being rocked by a coup attempt, people head to polls in Benin this sunday for legislative elections. And Senegal become the first team to book their spot in semi-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations.

events.title: EU greenlights Mercosur trade deal, von der Leyen 'looks forward' to signing 'soon'
events.description: No description available.

events.title: EU leaders visit Syria and pledge support for recovery after years of civil war
events.description: Top European Union officials have visited Syria for the first time to meet with interim President Ahmad al-Sharaa

events.title: Syria signals renewed cooperation on chemical weapons destruction
events.description: Progress continues to be made towards eliminating remnants of the chemical weapons programme in Syria that was developed under the Assad regime, the UN Security Council heard on Thursday.

events.title: Syria: Aleppo fighting leaves civilians dead, displaces thousands
events.description: At least five civilians have been killed and some 30,000 people displaced following renewed fighting in Aleppo, Syria, prompting calls from the UN for immediate de-escalation and a return to political talks.

events.title: Drones, fear and exhaustion: The daily reality of providing aid to Ukraine
events.description: Almost four years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, aid teams continue to adapt to the lethal reality of working in a modern war zone.

events.title: WATCH: Bodycam for Ohio dentist murders shows police went to wrong home before couple was found dead
events.description: Columbus police officers went to the wrong address during a welfare check before an Ohio dentist and his wife were found shot to death 40 minutes later by friend.

events.title: Trump cancels 'second wave of attacks' against Venezuela and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Russia warns Western forces in Ukraine would be considered 'legitimate combat targets'
events.description: Russia warns Western forces deployed to Ukraine under postwar security deal would be "legitimate combat targets" as diplomatic tensions escalate.

events.title: Iran leader says protesters are vandals trying to please Trump
events.description: The largest demonstrations in years have left at least 48 protesters dead, human rights groups say. Trump told reporters on Friday that Iran was in "big trouble'.

events.title: Trump seeks $100bn for Venezuela oil, but Exxon boss says country 'uninvestable'
events.description: Oil executives expressed caution, with one executive saying Venezuela had seized their assets twice.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Trump promises oil companies ‘total safety’ in Venezuela as he urges them to invest billions
events.description: Country is ‘uninvestable’ today, president told, but CEOs signal they are ready to spend with support Donald Trump promised oil giants “total safety, total security” in Venezuela in an effort to persuade them to invest $100bn in the country’s infrastructure after US forces toppled Nicolás Maduro from power. At a roundtable press conference at the White House on Friday afternoon with more than a dozen oil executives, including leaders from Chevron, ExxonMobil and ConocoPhilips, the US president doubled down on claims that Maduro’s arrest presents American oil companies with an unprecedented opportunity for extraction. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says the U.S. could be in Venezuela for 'years.' What that could look like
events.description: President Trump has said the U.S. may be "running" Venezuela for years, raising questions about the administration's plans for the country and how long they might take.

events.title: Russia fires hypersonic missile at target in Ukraine near NATO border
events.description: Russia struck a target in the Ukrainian city of Lviv overnight with its powerful Oreshnik hypersonic missile, just 40 miles from the border with NATO-member Poland.

events.title: Filipino Catholics express outrage over corruption scandal during massive religious procession
events.description: A massive crowd of mostly barefoot Filipino Catholics is joining an annual procession of a centuries-old statue of Jesus Christ in the Philippine capital, with some using the gathering to express outrage over a corruption scandal involving influential ...

events.title: Venezuela to release a 'significant number' of prisoners as gesture to 'seek peace'
events.description: Venezuela plans to release a "significant number" of prisoners, both Venezuelan and foreign, according to the head of the national assembly

events.title: Mamdani pledged to fight for all but scrapped order Jewish students say protected them
events.description: Jewish students at NYU and Columbia express fears after NYC Mayor Mamdani revoked the city's antisemitism definition, worrying about campus protests.

events.title: Russia hits Ukraine with rarely used Oreshnik missile in fresh strikes
events.description: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.

events.title: Syrian army ramps up Aleppo strikes against Kurdish fighters
events.description: The Syrian army is combing through the Sheikh Maqsoud neighbourhood of Aleppo as fighting intensifies.

events.title: Petro says Colombia cooperating with US ‘despite insults, threats’
events.description: Speaking to Al Jazeera, Gustavo Petro calls for 'shared government through dialogue' in Venezuela, leading to elections.

events.title: UN ‘gravely alarmed’ by fighting in Aleppo, urges protection of civilians
events.description: As a ceasefire between the Syrian army and the Kurdish-led SDF collapses, the UN is urging the protection of civilians.

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: US military forces seize fifth tanker in effort to control Venezuelan oil
events.description: Pre-dawn assault on the Olina oil tanker was carried out by US marines and navy sailors in the Caribbean near Trinidad US politics live – latest updates The US early on Friday boarded another oil tanker, the US military said, as part of efforts to target sanctions-busting vessels traveling to and from Venezuela . US forces were seen in video footage that officials posted online landing on the ship’s deck as the vessel named Olina was seized in the Caribbean near Trinidad . It is the fifth interdiction of such ships in recent weeks, separately from the series of previous US operations since the start of the fall to strike suspected drug boats off the coast of Venezuela. Continue reading...

events.title: How are Greenlanders responding to Trump's threats to acquire the territory?
events.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks to Naaja Nathanielsen, a government minister in Greenland, about President Trump's latest threats to buy or acquire the territory, and how Greenlanders are responding.

events.title: Iran's supreme leader says protesters are 'ruining their own streets' to please Trump
events.description: Iran's supreme leader signaled Friday that security forces would crack down on protesters after they screamed from windows and marched through the streets overnight, directly challenging U.S. President Trump's pledge to support those peacefully demonstrating.

events.title: Syrian army renews strikes on Kurdish forces in Aleppo
events.description: The military launched strikes after Kurdish forces rejected what they called demands to "surrender." The Syrian government has been struggling to unite disparate groups since taking power a year ago.

events.title: Swiss bar owner held after deadly New Year fire
events.description: Investigators have placed one of the owners of the bar where a blaze quickly spread at a New Year party in pretrial detention. Meanwhile, Switzerland held a ceremony to mourn the dozens of victims.

events.title: Germany news: Winter storm halts train service in north
events.description: Germany's train operator has halted long-distance train service around Hanover as a winter storm delivers a blast of snow and wind. Follow DW.

events.title: Capturing Maduro, A Grab for Greenland, Iran Unrest
events.description: In a week that saw the capture of Nicolas Maduro, Operation Absolute Resolve played out in just two hours and 28 minutes. The combined military precision and tactical deception by U.S. land, sea, and air forces led to Maduro and his wife, Cecilia Flores, being snatched from a fortress-like compound in Caracas.

events.title: Leaders in Iran facing most serious threat since 1979 revolution
events.description: Millions of people in Iran are now united around the hope of destroying the Islamic Republic and removing its leader, Ayatollah Khamenei.

events.title: Winter storm slams UK and France, leaving tens of thousands without power
events.description: Thousands of homes and businesses across northern France and southern England were without power Friday morning and residents faced widespread travel delays after a storm swept in off the Atlantic, bringing high winds, rain and snow to the region

events.title: Syria announces ceasefire after days of clashes with Kurdish fighters in Aleppo
events.description: Syria's Defense Ministry has announced a ceasefire after three days of clashes between government forces and Kurdish fighters in Aleppo

events.title: Iran judiciary chief vows there will be 'decisive' punishment for protesters
events.description: Iran's judiciary chief has vowed decisive punishment for protesters, signaling a coming crackdown against demonstrations

events.title: Russia says it used new Oreshnik ballistic missile against Ukraine
events.description: Russia says the military has used the new Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile in a strike on Ukraine

events.title: Ukraine: New strikes disrupt basic services for millions
events.description: Several parts of Ukraine were hit by a new wave of Russian strikes between Wednesday and Thursday morning.

events.title: Philadelphia sheriff rips ICE as 'fake, wannabe law enforcement,' threatening arrests: 'Don't want this smoke'
events.description: Philadelphia Sheriff Rochelle Bilal slammed ICE as "madeup, fake, wannabe law enforcement" officers who violate both the "legal" and "moral" law.

events.title: Exiled Iranian crown prince urges Trump to help as protests against Islamic regime intensify: 'Man of peace'
events.description: Exiled Iranian Crown Prince Pahlavi appeals to President Donald Trump for immediate intervention as Iran implements internet blackout amid deadly protests.

events.title: Venezuela teeters as guerrilla groups, cartels exploit Maduro power vacuum
events.description: Criminal networks including Tren de Aragua cartel and ELN guerrillas exploit power vacuum in Venezuela after former President Nicolás Maduro's arrest, threatening transition efforts.

events.title: Venezuela starts ‘exploratory process’ to re-establish formal ties with US
events.description: US State Department officials are visiting Caracas less than a week after the military abduction of Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: New video said to show Syrian army shelling Aleppo’s Sheikh Maqsoud area
events.description: The Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces have shared new video of the Syrian army shelling a large weapons depot.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: With a new leader and tired opponent, this should be the Victorian Liberals’ year – if not for self-inflicted wounds
events.description: As dysfunction reigns, the party shows yet again that its greatest obstacle to winning government is not Labor but itself Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast This should be the Victorian Liberal party’s year. They head into November’s election with a new, energetic and articulate leader in Jess Wilson , who has vowed to drag her party to the centre and reconnect with voters it has lost in recent years. Across the aisle stands a weary third-term Labor government, burdened by the state’s debt – forecast to hit $192bn by 2028-29 – and the baggage of more than a decade in power. No Victorian Labor government has ever secured a fourth term – a fact that should give the Liberals cause for optimism. Continue reading...

events.title: US seizes Venezuela-linked Olina oil tanker in Caribbean
events.description: It is the fifth vessel seized by the United States in recent weeks. Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said Olina had departed Venezuela and attempted "to evade US forces."

events.title: Germany: Trust in the United States is eroding
events.description: In the monthly ARD Deutschlandtrend poll, Germans polled expressed little confidence that 2026 will be a peaceful and prosperous year. The reputation of the US is at an all-time low.

events.title: Beyond the seized oil tanker Marinera: Growing fleet reflags to Russia
events.description: The United States announced on Wednesday that it had “seized” the Marinera, an oil tanker with links to Venezuela, in the North Atlantic. During the US pursuit of this boat, the Marinera changed its name (from the Bella 1) and swapped out its former flag for the Russian flag. Turns out, this isn’t a first: experts say that Moscow has agreed to lend its flag and its protection to other so-called “dark fleet” ships attempting to circumnavigate the US blockade.

events.title: EU states back record South America trade deal after 25 years
events.description: EU states gave a provisional go-ahead on Friday for the bloc to sign its largest ever free trade accord with South American group Mercosur, more than 25 years since talks began and after months of wrangling to secure enough backers.

events.title: Hungary's Orbán says Budapest is Europe’s safest city for Jews as antisemitism surges
events.description: Hungarian PM Viktor Orbán claims Jewish communities are safer in Budapest than elsewhere in Europe, amid ADL reports of sharp rise in antisemitic incidents.

events.title: EU reaches South America trade deal after 25 years of talks
events.description: Some farmers in Europe opposed the deal, but the EU Commission said it had listened to their concerns.

events.title: EU reaches South America trade deal after 25 years of talks
events.description: Some farmers in Europe opposed the deal, but the EU Commission said it had listened to their concerns.

events.title: Fate of Yemeni separatists unclear after STC ‘disbands’
events.description: An official with Yemen’s separatist Southern Transitional Council rejected an announcement that the group is disbanding.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be: NPR/Ipsos poll
events.description: Commissioned by NPR in partnership with Ipsos, the poll also highlights sharp partisan divides on key foreign policy issues.

events.title: G7 rescheduled so Trump can attend White House cage match
events.description: The G7 summit was originally scheduled for June 14-16. The meeting, however, was reportedly moved so US President Donald Trump would be at the White House for a UFC fight on June 14, his 80th birthday.

events.title: Mexico boasts sharp decline in homicides, but analysts urge caution
events.description: The Mexican government reports a sharp decline in homicide rates, claiming its security strategy is working

events.title: UAE cuts funding for citizens studying at UK universities over campus radicalization fears: report
events.description: The UAE is pulling scholarships from U.K. universities, citing fears Emirati students could be radicalized amid tensions over Britain and the Muslim Brotherhood.

events.title: European allies working on plan if US acts on acquiring Greenland: report
events.description: Countries in Europe reportedly are working on a plan if the Trump administration makes a move on acquiring Greenland, which is a a Danish territory.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Trump says US needs to 'own' Greenland to prevent Russia and China from taking it
events.description: We will do it "the easy way" or "the hard way", he said, but Denmark says the territory is not for sale.

events.title: X could face UK ban over deepfakes, minister says
events.description: It comes after government urged Ofcom to use all its powers – up to and including an effective ban – against X.

events.title: US film stars Meagan Good and Jonathan Majors to become Guinea citizens after DNA tests
events.description: The pair join other US celebrities reconnecting with their African heritage and taking up citizenship.

events.title: Venezuelan government begins releasing political prisoners
events.description: The US, which recently captured its President Nicolás Maduro, has long demanded the detainees be freed.

events.title: 'I feel free': Australia's social media ban, one month on
events.description: Some say they've lost interest in social media since the ban, while others say nothing has changed.

events.title: The continued mysteries surrounding the intelligence operation to seize Maduro
events.description: From intelligence sources to intricate mission plans, some details are becoming clearer - but many questions remain unanswered.

events.title: Trump promises oil executives ‘total safety’ if they invest in Venezuela
events.description: Experts said oil execs gave a 'less-than-full-throated' approval as they waited on terms from US and Venezuela.

events.title: Diaz scores again as Morocco edge out Cameroon in AFCON 2025 quarterfinal
events.description: Real Madrid's Brahim Diaz continues 2025 AFCON scoring streak as Morocco edge out Cameroon in quarterfinals.

events.title: Senegal beat Mali to book first AFCON 2025 semifinal spot
events.description: Senegal beat Mali 1-0 to reach AFCON 2025 semifinal where defending champions Ivory Coast or record winners Egypt await.

events.title: Big and small oil companies summoned to meet Trump on Venezuelan oil
events.description: Many of the smaller firms have connections to Denver, Colorado, the home turf of Energy Secretary Chris Wright.

events.title: US intercepts fifth sanctioned oil tanker
events.description: The US seized a fifth oil tanker in the Caribbean as Washington ramps up seizing on sanctioned Venezuelan oil shipments.

events.title: Minneapolis leaders urge transparency, independent probe after ICE killing
events.description: Mayor Jacob Frey calls on Trump administration to follow the facts amid growing outrage over killing of mother of three.

events.title: Is the US unlocking Venezuela’s oil wealth or exploiting it?
events.description: President Donald Trump aims to control and revive Venezuela's oil industry. Critics call it modern-day colonialism.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record £2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for £2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo’s main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the “Tuna King”, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan’s northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela releases imprisoned opposition figures, which Trump says U.S. requested
events.description: Venezuela released a number of imprisoned high-profile opposition figures, activists and journalists, in what the government described as a gesture to "seek peace".

events.title: Trump to meet with U.S. oil executives for help reviving Venezuela's oil industry
events.description: President Trump wants U.S. oil companies to help revitalize Venezuela's struggling oil industry. But with oil prices low and the political future uncertain, oil companies may be reluctant to gamble.

events.title: A long U.S. stay in Venezuela? What past interventions reveal
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Washington Post columnist David Ignatius about what the U.S. staying in Venezuela for years might look like and the history of U.S. involvement in other countries.

events.title: 'The atmosphere is very authoritarian': Venezuela's opposition reels from the sidelines
events.description: President Trump sidelined Venezuela's opposition and is working with remnants of the regime led by ousted leader Nicolás Maduro. What's next for the opposition?

events.title: Epiphany blackface in Spain highlights racism in Europe
events.description: People in Spain called attention to racism after a public official wore blackface at an Epiphany celebration. Countries such as the Netherlands have begun moving away from blackface traditions after efforts by activists.

events.title: Djigui Diarra's time at AFCON ends after impressive performance
events.description: While Mali's campaign at the African Cup of Nations has ended, their 1-0 loss against Senegal would have been much heavier if it wasn't for their goalkeeper's fantastic saves when the Eagles were reduced to 10 men. Djigui Diarra had already impressed in their penalty shootout against Tunisia and his performances are set to be one of the highlights of this tournament.

events.title: Morocco find confidence while Senegal struggle for semifinal spot
events.description: The host nation outclassed Cameroon and provided new hope to fans as they sealed a convincing 2-0 win against the Indomitable Lions. Brahim Diaz and Ismael Saibari found the net either side of half time, however Cameroon were unable to cause any harm up front. Senegal meanwhile needed just a single goal courtesy of Iliman Ndiaye to beat a 10-man Mali side, whose Yves Bissouma was sent off after picking up a second yellow card. We also take a look at Saturday's other quarter-finals, where Algeria will take on Nigeria and seven-time champions Egypt will face defending champions Ivory Coast.

events.title: Crans-Montana bar owner Jacques Moretti detained by police
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Colombian rebels must unite to fight US, guerrilla leader says
events.description: The ‌head of the largest dissident ​branch of the former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) ​guerrilla group has ​called on rebel ‍groups to come together to fight US interventionism.

events.title: £200m allocated for UK armed forces deployment to Ukraine
events.description: The government has allocated £200m of funding to prepare the UK's armed forces to be deployed to Ukraine in the event of a peace deal.

events.title: Two Russian citizens aboard captured oil tanker released by US, Russia claims
events.description: Two Russian citizens who were aboard the oil tanker seized by US special forces on Wednesday have been released, Russia has claimed.

events.title: US intercepts third tanker in a week as it tightens control over Venezuelan oil
events.description: The US military says its forces have seized a third oil tanker in the space of a week.

events.title: US treasury secretary says Argentina has repaid its US credit line in a win for Milei
events.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says that Argentina has repaid the funds it drew from a $20 billion credit line with the Trump administration

events.title: Pope to visit Spain this year, with stops in Madrid, Barcelona and Canary Islands, cardinal says
events.description: Pope Leo XIV is planning to travel to Spain this year

events.title: Yemen’s Southern Transitional Council to dismantle, a day after its leader fled to the UAE
events.description: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council and its institutions are being dismantled, the group's secretary-general has announced

events.title: More diplomatic and economic tensions surface between China, Japan as a bumpy week ends
events.description: A week in which longtime tensions between neighbors China and Japan ratcheted up economically and politically is drawing to a close with no sign of improvements

events.title: Brazil’s Lula vetoes bill that could reduce Bolsonaro’s prison time
events.description: Brazil’s President Lula da Silva has vetoed a bill that could reduce Jair Bolsonaro’s 27-year prison sentence for his failed 2023 coup attempt

events.title: Aid continues despite winter hardship in Gaza and West Bank, UN says
events.description: Despite harsh winter conditions and continuing access constraints, the UN and partners are maintaining large-scale humanitarian operations in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, with a focus on shelter, water, health and education.

events.title: Pennsylvania man allegedly found with over 100 sets of human remains in home, storage unit: ‘Horror movie'
events.description: Jonathan Gerlach, 34, was arrested after "over 100 full or partial sets of human and skeletal remains" were allegedly found in his home and a storage unit.

events.title: Ohio dentist murders: Alley video, no forced entry fuel insider fears, experts say
events.description: Surveillance video shows person of interest near Ohio dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique's home before double murder. Columbus police seek public help.

events.title: US forces seize oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea in pre-dawn mission
events.description: U.S. forces boarded a tanker known as Olina in ongoing campaign against vessels evading Venezuela sanctions blockade, the U.S. Southern Command said.

events.title: UK keeps billions in Venezuelan gold reserves frozen at Bank of England after Maduro arrest
events.description: Bank of England keeps billions in Venezuelan gold frozen since 2020 amid legal battle following Nicolás Maduro's arrest and interim leader appointment.

events.title: Christians targeted in systematic kidnapping campaign in Nigeria by jihadi herdsmen, experts say
events.description: One Nigerian church paid $205,000 ransom for 50 kidnapped members as Fulani militants allegedly wage economic jihad against Christians in Middle Belt.

events.title: 'Irregular' armed guards aboard Russian shadow tankers alarm Nordic-Baltic governments
events.description: Russia demands humane treatment of the crew aboard the seized oil tanker Marinera, and the White House says the Venezuelan shadow fleet vessel faces prosecution.
